result.execSummary:
The defendant Kenneth F Olesiak was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Lewd, Lascivious Behavior-Exposure, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 944.20(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Attorney Fees To Be Determined. 
Financial obligations are due within 60 days of the sentence date. The Barron County Clerk of Courts shall collect all financial obligations. In the event of non-payment of outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.

Must undergo a Psycho-Sexual Evaluation and follow up with any treatment recommendations.
Must complete any and all evaluations, counseling, treatment and follow-up recommended by Probation Agent. 
Order for DNA given to defendant in court. Must report to the Barron County Jail immediately to submit DNA sample.

timeConds.notes: With Work Release.  Must report by 2:30 p.m. today, Thursday July 21, 2022.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Kenneth F Olesiak

records.addlTxt:
1:29 PM Prosecuting attorney Brian H. Wright in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Kenneth F Olesiak in court.  Attorney Andrew Joseph Harrington in court for Kenneth F Olesiak. DE pleads guilty to count 1.  Court performs colloquy and finds plea is knowingly, voluntarily, and intelligently given, accepts plea, and finds guilty.  Victim statement provided to court. Argument by state. Argument by defense. DE addresses the court.  

Court relates and orders:
SW.
1 year probation. 
20 days conditional jail with work release - must report by 2:30 PM today.
Pshcho-sexual evaluation and follow any treatment recommendations. 
Costs to be paid in 60 days.
Order for DNA given to defendant in court. Must report to the Barron County Jail immediately to submit DNA sample.

10:14 AM Prosecuting attorney Brian H. Wright Aty in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Kenneth F Olesiak in court.  Attorney Andrew Joseph Harrington in court for Kenneth F Olesiak. 
Set for plea hearing. Must appear in person.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for July 21, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
and Order.  Andrew Harrington appointed.  Repay $25.00 per month starting 04/15/22 ***DIRECT PAY***
records.descr: Pet for appointment counsel,affidavit of indigency

records.addlTxt: Attorney fees.  Andrew Harrington appointed.  Repay $25.00 per month ***DIRECT PAY***

Defendant shall be fingerprinted at the Barron County Sheriff's Dept., if not already done.
If represented by the Public Defender and does not have a phone, must contact the Public Defender weekly at 715-908-8473.

Must have no contact with M. L. O.
Must have no contact with the Justice Center unless with law enforcement. Must make arrangements through Dispatch ahead of time.

10:44 AM Prosecuting attorney Brian H. Wright Aty appeared in court for the State of Wisconsin, Defendant Kenneth F Olesiak appeared in court.
Does not qualify for Public Defender. Blue form presented. Court appoints Andrew Harrington and orders repayment of $25.00 per month directly to attorney starting 4/15/22.  Not guilty plea entered.  Next hearing may be by zoom.  Bond set.
Hearing scheduled for June 8, 2022 at 10:00 am.
